column4: Amazon.com says review finds women get equal pay at company

column4: Apple bets new 4-inch iPhone to draw big-screen converts in China  India
column5: CUPERTINO  Calif/MUMBAI Apple Inc  is betting a new 4-inch iPhone will spur smartphone users in key markets such as China and India to ditch their larger-screens in favor of the diminutive  yet feature-rich and lower-priced iPhone SE. | Video

column4: Apple hopes small is big again as iPhone SE debuts
column5: CUPERTINO  Calif. Apple Inc  on Monday launched its least expensive iPhone  the $399 iPhone SE  filling a hole in its product lineup with a small-screen model that targets new customers in emerging markets and fans of smaller phones as the company tries to reverse falling phone sales. | Video

column4: Twitter testing new 'Stickers' feature - report
column5: March 22 Twitter Inc is testing a new feature called 'Stickers' to add images to photos before tweeting them  tech news site Re/code reported on Tuesday.

column4: Yum in talks with KKR  others to sell stake in China unit: WSJ
column5: Yum Brands Inc  is in talks with private equity company KKR & Co LP  and others about a possible sale of a nearly 20 percent stake in its China business  the Wall Street Journal reported  citing people familiar with the matter.

column4: Yum in talks with KKR to sell stake in China unit-CNBC citing DJ
column5: March 23 Yum Brands Inc  the owner of the KFC and Pizza Hut chains  is in talks with private equity company KKR & Co LP and others about a possible sale of a 19.9 percent stake in its China business  CNBC reported  citing Dow Jones.
